Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task or issue within the TaskFlow project management system.

description.description: A detailed description of the task.

status.description: The current status of the task (e.g., To Do, In Progress, Done).

createdAt.description: The date and time the task was created.

updatedAt.description: The date and time the task was last updated.

issueId.description: The ID of the issue this comment belongs to.

authorId.description: The ID of the user who wrote the comment.

content.description: The text content of the comment.

parentCommentId.description: The ID of the parent comment, for threaded replies.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the comment was created.

CommentVote.title: Comment Vote
CommentVote.description: Represents a user's upvote on a comment.

commentId.description: The ID of the comment that was voted on.

userId.description: The ID of the user who cast the vote.

definition.description: Stores task information. Open access to all authenticated users.

params.name: taskId
params.description: The unique identifier for the task.

params.name: commentId
params.description: The unique identifier for the comment.

definition.description: Stores upvotes for comments, ensuring one vote per user per comment.

params.name: voteId
params.description: The unique identifier for the vote, often a composite of userId and commentId.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to be simple and scalable. Tasks, comments, and comment votes are stored in separate top-level collections. This allows for efficient querying of comments for an issue and votes for a comment without deeply nested data structures. This model supports the requested features while keeping the data hierarchy flat and easy to manage.
